entry.title: Criccieth Castle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Criccieth Castle (pictured) combined the "latest advances in military technology" with the "haphazard Welsh castle building style"?

entry.title: Jerry Atkinson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jerry Atkinson, a manager for a department store, helped prevent the Green Bay Packers from going insolvent in 1949 and 1950?

entry.title: Guren no Yumiya (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the most tweeted word on New Year's Eve 2013 related to the anime opening theme "Guren no Yumiya"?

entry.title: Carlos Santana Tovar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Carlos Santana Tovar, who represented Amazonas in the 1952 Venezuelan Constituent Assembly, was taken hostage during the 1921 revolution and only escaped years later?

entry.title: Only Up! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Only Up! was removed from Steam twice: first over copyright violations and subsequently to alleviate the developer's stress?

entry.title: Lunar Ejecta and Meteorites (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Lunar Ejecta and Meteorites experiment continuously overheated and had to be switched off during the lunar noon?

entry.title: a collection of his father's poetry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Brian Herbert, the son of Frank Herbert, may have left a poem out of a collection of his father's poetry because it was "too racy"?

entry.title: Prince William (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Prince William reportedly used the name "Steve" while studying at the University of St Andrews to avoid attracting attention from the media?
